headline: Bernie Sanders Questions Jeff Bezos' Motives Over Amazon's $200 Billion AI Spending: 'What A Surprise'
summary: On Thursday, Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) targeted Jeff Bezos, noting Amazon.com, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AMZN) planned $200 billion investment in artificial intelligence and robotics. Sanders Targets Amazon's AI And Robotics Push In a post on X, Sanders argued that Bezos is pouring billions into AI while Amazon replaces workers with machines. "Jeff Bezos is spending $200 billion on AI and robotics," Sanders wrote, adding that the company is "replacing hundreds of thousands of his workers at Amazon with r

headline: Emmanuel Macron Says 'Amazon, Your Package Has Been Delivered' After Ariane 6 Blasts Off With 32 Satellites To Rival Starlink
summary: On Thursday, the French president celebrated Europe's most powerful rocket launch after it successfully deployed 32 Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) Leo satellites into orbit, as Jeff Bezos steps up his challenge to SpaceX's Starlink. Ariane 6 Launches 32 Amazon Satellites Emmanuel Macron hailed the successful liftoff of Europe's upgraded Ariane 6, writing on X, "Amazon, your package has been delivered." The rocket, launched by the European Space Agency from French Guiana around 1:45 p.m. local tim

headline: InterDigital’s Patent Wins With Disney Hisense And TCL Shape Licensing Outlook
summary: InterDigital, NasdaqGS: IDCC, secured a patent injunction against Disney in Germany related to HEVC video compression technology. The ruling represents the fifth injunction win for InterDigital in its ongoing video patent enforcement efforts. InterDigital has filed new patent lawsuits against Hisense and TCL across multiple jurisdictions to enforce its video technology licensing program. InterDigital, NasdaqGS: IDCC, focuses on research and patent licensing around wireless, video, and other...

headline: Disney IP Setbacks And AI Lawsuit Put Long Term Story In Focus
summary: Disney, NYSE:DIS, is facing fresh intellectual property setbacks in Germany linked to InterDigital patent infringement claims. A new injunction adds to earlier rulings in Germany and Brazil on similar technology issues. At the same time, Disney has filed a major lawsuit against ByteDance over alleged unauthorized use of its content in an AI video generation tool. For investors watching NYSE:DIS, these legal moves come as the shares trade around $105.45, with a 3% decline over the past week...
